Posts.Content: I saw the radiologist yesterday and he actually prescribed some cream!  In France they say not to use anything.  It's red and itchy, but he says I have a "moderate" reaction.  am going to use the cream every day now (only a couple of weeks left to go!) I have started feeling more tired recently (my husband works in another city during the week and I have 2 boys to look after).  I've had a low grade fever for the last couple of days - radiologist said I should rest in bed; I wish I could!
Posts.Title: Radio therapy

Posts.Content: I'm more than fed up and I haven't even had an operation yet.  I didn't realise they could take out such a big lump without doing a mastectomy.  How big was the tumour?  Mine was huge and is now still pretty large (around 4cm).  They are trying to shrink it but I can't feel any massive difference. dreading meeting the surgeon, but also looking forward to it as it brings the "endpoint" a bit nearer. onward and upward! C
Posts.Title: Fed up

Posts.Content: Hi Gill, Sorry to meet you under such circumstances.  I was diagnosed with a huge tumour in June and did neo-adjuvant chemo.  It shrank from about 8cm to about 4.  I have my last chemo on Thursday and am booked for a mastectomy on 2 Jan. It's tough but you'll get through it. Bonne courage! Caroline in France
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed.

Posts.Content: I'm changing hospitals for the radiotherapy too (on advice of radiologist).  He (radiologist) doesn't seem to think it will be too tiring (!) and thinks I should go back to work then (part time).  He's thinking more of reducing travel time than fatigue. Good luck to you and hope you find a workable solution. Caroline
Posts.Title: change hospitals for radiotherapy?

Posts.Content: your photos are great and v inspiring.  you are v brave to post them! I'm exactly a month behind you, so it's been a week for me (yesterday).  Steristrips still stubbornly in place, still having trouble sleeping, arm still tight, Not sure about seroma or not, no bruising but it looks "rounder" than I would expect - maybe that's just the shape of the pectoral muscle?  Kind of like an action man doll! I'm seeing the surgeon and oncologist on 22nd (seems ages away!) and have persuaded husband to come; initially he said Wednesdays were 'inconvenient' and offered to come to the radiology appointment but that, although I may get some results, won't involve me standing half-naked in the middle of a room while random French men poke at me - he seems to agree! :) Off to London on Thursday, I think it will be fine. Let us know on here when you update your blog because I find it really useful.  I should do one too but I'm going to use the time to catch up on my studying instead. C
Posts.Title: One Month Later - Mastectomy photos if anyone would like to see

Posts.Content: Hi Dawn, He can't come after all now :( but will come to the radiology appointment a couple of days before (hospital says they will have the results too) I have been promised a trip to the cinema "to make up for it" which I suppose is nice. Laughing at French DIY mishaps.  I always have to mime a lot and explain what I want.  It was the same when I bought stationery at work. "You know, those metal things that hold paper together that come out of a little machine" (staples) My arm is a  lot better today, I can see a sort of "cord" in my armpit but the numbness is wearing off.  Not sure about seroma.  Will have another look this evening (hard to get into the shower in the mornings in this house). Meeting a friend for lunch today.  I should put some nicer clothes on (am wearing my sons jeans and a ratty black jumper) C
Posts.Title: One Month Later - Mastectomy photos if anyone would like to see

Posts.Content: I had Emend for three days and then something beginning with Z that made me constipated so I didn't always take it.  I didn't feel sick on FEC except after the second time.  Can't remember headaches, I was taking painkillers with the Taxotere
Posts.Title: Headache afterFEC

Posts.Content: Good luck with the scan, Binny, hope it's not the case that they think something bad is going on, take care, Caroline xxx
Posts.Title: Need some help here girls....

Posts.Content: Hi Mandi, I've got my last chemo on Thursday, then mastectomy after Christmas, followed by radiotherapy.  I'm fed up too. Sorry to hear about your nerve damage.  Was that the Taxotere? Caroline xx
Posts.Title: Im New

Posts.Content: I had chemo, then surgery and am waiting for radiotherapy to begin.  When I had my post op meeting with the surgeon (who sent his assistant) they said I might need more chemo (!)  The oncologist says he doesn't really think it's worth it, but I am waiting to see what they decide … argh!
Posts.Title: Chemo decision. Yes or no?

Posts.Content: Just don't forget the chocolate!  I'm not a huge choc fan but I needed mine. Also magazines!
Posts.Title: op day tomorrow

Posts.Content: Maybe you can get a friend to tell your mum?  then you can discuss it with her later.  I didn't feel up to telling my family either.  I got my husband to tell my father, and then he told my mother, sister and brother. Good luck with work, I've been off since July and need to think about going back soon. Caroline

It's crap and horrible but you will get through it because you have to.  I have done 4 FEC and 3 out of 4 Tax. A lot of the side effects they told me about i didn't get.  I suppose its like when you read the label inside an aspirin packet and they tell you all kinds of terrible things that can happen (but usually don't). I just got a date for my mastectomy (had the chemo first) so am freaking out about drains.  I was v traumatised by hair loss but now it's coming back I find other things to worry about! Bonne Courage!  You can do it! Caroline
Posts.Title: Chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: My oncologist said "it doesn't work, don't bother" but another doctor at the hospital said I should because it could help with re-growth.  So I used it for the first 2 FEC (then didn't bother to ask for it) and have used it for the two Tax I've had so far.  I thought I might as well if I have to ice fingers and toes anyway!  I keep forgetting to take paracetamol in advance (and it's VERY cold!) I've lost most of my hair (although I still have some hair on my arms (not under, on) and have kept my eyebrows although eyelashes are looking a bit sparse (my son said this morning "your eyes look weird" but I think that's more because I had 10 hours sleep and didn't put on any make up!) C So, I'd say if you can put up with the unpleasant coldness, you might as well give it a go
Posts.Title: Starting EC and advice on scalp cooling please!!!

Posts.Content: My oncologist said "it doesn't work, don't bother" but another doctor at the hospital said I should because it could help with re-growth.  So I used it for the first 2 FEC (then didn't bother to ask for it) and have used it for the two Tax I've had so far.  I thought I might as well if I have to ice fingers and toes anyway!  I keep forgetting to take paracetamol in advance (and it's VERY cold!) I've lost most of my hair (although I still have some hair on my arms (not under, on) and have kept my eyebrows although eyelashes are looking a bit sparse (my son said this morning "your eyes look weird" but I think that's more because I had 10 hours sleep and didn't put on any make up!) C So, I'd say if you can put up with the unpleasant coldness, you might as well give it a go
Posts.Title: Starting EC and advice on scalp cooling please!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Marg, I had a single mastectomy but I imagine it's similar.  Take lots to read, take snacks (hospital food may not be very nice) make sure people visit you. The waiting is the worst bit before the op, and after it's the drains that are a complete pain (not literally but annoying to carry around) I'm sure you will be fine with your positive attitude and great sense of humour. I'll be thinking of you, GOOD LUCK!!! Caroline
Posts.Title: op day tomorrow

Posts.Content: Just to add, yes mouth side effects worst for me too.  Take the anti sickness pills (even if they cause constipation).  Use mouthwash, clean your teeth a lot, eat pineapple. I did find I felt tired but generally it's the second week that's worst.  Week three you feel like you're getting back to normal and then they poison you again. Make sure you get all the prescriptions filled in advance so you don't have to go to the chemist if you feel bad.  We have an extra cancer corner in addition to our normal bathroom stuff now. C xxx
Posts.Title: Chemo tomorrow
I Wish I'd Felt Both Of Me Tits - (adapted from Pam Ayers)

Posts.Content: The oncologist told me it didn't prevent hair loss but then the doctor I saw before the first session said that even if it didn't, it might promote regrowth so it was worth doing. C
Posts.Title: Cold Cap Experience

Posts.Content: Hello, I'v had two FEC treatments now (3rd one on Friday) and used the cold cap (I am in France).  I had a lot of hair fall out 3 weeks after the first treatment, but am not sure what to expect now.  Is there a big loss 17 days after every treatment?  I still have hair but it is very thin and I wouldn't go out without covering it. The cap seems to have worked, as the doctor looked surprised that I still had hair.  I only had it on during the treatment, not afterwards and there was no machine to cool it, they just brought a new one when it started melting! C
Posts.Title: Cold Cap Experience

Posts.Content: Thanks Judith and Gillie! I've submitted my last essay for my studies and the children are going skiing for a week from 12 Arpil (and husband has to go somewhere too) so I'll have a week to myself to tidy away all the books and papers, go back to the gym and start planning for the next stage in my life. xxxxx C
Posts.Title: Nearly Finished - what's next?

Posts.Content: Good luck with the Chem, Marg.  It's horrible, but it does end! I had my last one on 28 Nov so I am sort of "back to normal" as regards blood count.  hair is growing back, mouth tastes more normal, appetite returning.  Today though, I feel itchy all over which isn't nice. Daily Mirror tip is a good one!  Will try that next time I have insomnia. Cxxx
Posts.Title: cemo

Posts.Content: I have my last radiation session tomorrow and am seeing the radiologist for the last time on Tuesday.  I feel I should have questions but can't think of anything other than "When is someone going to take out this port-a-cath?" My cancer was triple negative so I guess that's it now?  I'm waiting for results of genetic test (due June) but they said it's only 15% likely that I have a BRCA mutation (I really hope I don't need more surgery). Has anyone got any advice for me?  GillieB - you've finished, haven't you? Caroline
Posts.Title: Nearly Finished - what's next?

Posts.Content: I was told to avoid grapefruit.  Nothing about yoghurt or peeling fruit and veg.  I travelled quite a lot when I was on chemo (had to take my son to school on the crowded metro every day too) and no injections.  I didn't get ill (from germs). Cxx
Posts.Title: Yogurt

Posts.Content: just got a package from Asda: 2 bras and a swimming costume.  The bras are really good and v cheap! Will go to prosthetic shop on Monday and start planning a trip to the pool! Caroline
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bras

Posts.Content: mine haven't all gone but was hoping they'd grow back along with my head hair, which is looking pretty good considering I'm still on the dotaxcetel. Well, I have several sets of false eyelashes and intend to use them over Christmas/New Year.  Haven't bothered so much as have been off work and my husband is away most of the time.  I am sure my mother in law will want me to use them! :) C Eyebrows also not really coming back, but I noticed some leg hair yesterday :( On the plus side, I had lunch with a friend I haven't seen for a while and she was surprised when I told her I was wearing a wig.  It looks sooo obvious to me!
Posts.Title: Eyelashes

Posts.Content: would love to see before and after pictures!
Posts.Title: Look Good Feeling Better

Posts.Content: You look great Alison!  Am looking forward to having a haircut, the curly bits at the back of my neck are really annoying me! Cxxx
Posts.Title: Look Good Feeling Better

Posts.Content: This is a good place for wigs: http://www.pakcosmetics.com I got a real hair one for a fraction of the price of my synthetic one at the special shop in Paris! They have pink ones and you can buy online!
Posts.Title: Eyelashes

Posts.Content: I'm currently looking for a new job.  I feel bad because my employer has been good, financially, but I don't want to deal with all the sympathetic glances, I'd rather start again where nobody knows my medical history.
Posts.Title: returning to work and it isn't the same

Posts.Content: I think it's also worthwhile remembering that if you don't feel positive that's ok too!  There's no evidence that "being positive" helps your recovery (although of course it's nicer to be positive than negative!) Let yourself feel angry and depressed if you need to. I agree with the taking one step at a time advice.  Looking back, I can't believe I made it through the chemo, it really was the worst.  But even bad things have to come to an end - I guess that's a positive thought? hugs, Caroline
Posts.Title: What ifs........

Posts.Content: I had constipation with FEC (I thought it was caused by the anti sickness pills though) and diarrhoea with the taxotere. Hope you feel better soon, Caroline
Posts.Title: First Chemo

Posts.Content: A friend of mine came and did Reiki for me (and offered to do it every week) but now she says she was "wrong to offer it" and I "have to ask for it or she won't do it" ??? What exactly is Reiki? (I am a sceptic!) How does it work and why is supposed to be good for cancer patients? My friend is still v supportive, comes round or we meet for lunch together, so she's not particularly being weird.  If it's useful (or it makes her happy to thin she's helping me) then yes, I am all for it, just not sure how to express this! C
Posts.Title: Reiki

Posts.Content: Thanks Sue! It was calming, I guess I just didn't express my gratitude properly!  I will ask her next time.  And offer cake and tea. :)
Posts.Title: Reiki

Posts.Content: My mammogram kept getting put off but immediately after I had it they said "you need to do a biopsy urgently - can you come back in 2 hours" so I was immediately concerned.   The dr doing the ultrasound actually went a bit pale as she looked at the monitor, so I was pretty sure it wasn't harmless. The dr that did the biopsy said "you can't walk around with that inside you, even if it turns out to be benign" The dr I initially went to when I found the lump was evasive about results saying "there are some abnormal cells but I haven't had all the results" Surgeon said "you have a large cancerous tumour, we'll need to operate, didn't your doctor tell you?" So I guess it varies a lot! I went to all those appointments alone too.  In retrospect it might have been nice to have someone with me but I didn't really plan and my husband was busy having an affair at the time in another country!
Posts.Title: Do docs play down cancer until they get biopsy results or can they...

Posts.Content: I start the taxotere next week (26th) but was told to start using nail varnish with sicilium (sp?) diribg my FEC to prepare them for the onslaught: http://www.laroche-posay.com/products-treatments/Silicium/Nails-r52.aspx Googled for you as la roche posay is a French brand but appears to be availbale in UK too.  There are a range of colours - I have bright read and a dusky pink.  I thouhgt I might use the th RP nail varnish as a base and then put black on top when I start the tax.  My nails are growing well and strong (but then again, it's summer ...) Good luck! Caroline
Posts.Title: Before I ........

Posts.Content: I've only had one so far and no bad side effects other than dry/bloody nose. And some weird boil ike spots on my lower back. They gave me tramadol but I took it more for the drowsiness factor. Next one's on Thursday ... will update! C
Posts.Title: 4 Day after 1st Taxotere and omg!!!!!!

Posts.Content: fizzy water with ice and lemon, pineapple, crystallised ginger I remember how vile that taste was.  Bonne courage! Caroline
Posts.Title: help please

Posts.Content: They took out 150 ml of fluid (yuk) Good news, nothing under arm, but not all of the cancer cells in the tumour were dead post mx so may have to do more chemo (no!!!!!) lovely oncologist says he's not in favour but needs to discuss with surgeon on Monday.  Radio scheduled to start 28 March, onc and I think this is too long to wait ... will ring on Tuesday other good news, am allowed to swim and have baths! C
Posts.Title: Feeling drained!

Posts.Content: Hello, I was diagnosed on June to and would like to chat - will pm you C
Posts.Title: Anyone need a friend

Posts.Content: we initially decided to do the tanning at a hospital nearer my house but I am happy to travel (25 minutes on the metro) if we can start earlier.  onc will talk to radiologist at my original hospital.  he says if we have to wait until the end of March they will have to poison me again (I'm not keen on that! especially after all the "the hardest bit is over comments!) C xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling drained!

Posts.Content: Hi there, Another grade 3 triple negative here.  I finished chemo on 28 Nov and still feel a bit odd (tingling in my fingers, problems with appetite etc.  I'm due to start radiotherapy later this month. hugs, Cxx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer triple neg grad 3

Posts.Content: Wow!  Thanks for replying so quickly! I did call a more sensible friend who said "I doubt you're going to have a huge temperature spike tonight" Kate, I'm not in the UK, am in France (just joined a similar French site but can't really write very well in French so prefer to come here)  I may still try and call the nurse tomorrow.  Not sure 0800 works from here but my mum (in London) could call for me. Gillie, not sure there's any chocolate left but will have warm bath, cover myself with moisturiser and get a good night's rest then call the dr tomorrow.  Lindy - took temperature (37.1) and then later 36.9 so I think I should be fine for the night at least. It's just annoying to have to take the kids to school on the metro with all the coughers and sneezers around on low immunity days.  I am planning to send them alone (ages 13 and 8) but the older one has his exchange student so they might chat to each other and ignore/lose the little one! My husband is back tomorrow night for the weekend so if necessary he will be able to do the childcare.  Thanks again for replying so quickly - you are all wonderful! Caroline
Posts.Title: taxotere side effects: infection question

Posts.Content: I'm on day 7 (or 8 I suppose as it was last Thursday early morning) and have a very mild sore throat (took lemon and honey) and very slight stinging sensation when I wee.  My temperature is normal, but do you think I might have an infection and what would that mean? There seems to be some kind of lack of clarity for when the low white cell nadir is for tax (some say day 7, others from day 9 etc)  I've had no other problems rather than slight chest/nose congestion which I believe is normal, lack of appetite and a bit of stomach upset. Should I call the doctor tomorrow?  I have all these instructions about getting a blood test if my temp goes above 38 degrees and then taking antibiotics, but I feel OK. I made the mistake of calling a friend and she freaked out and said "I'm coming over!" I said don't, I won't let you in because I'm going to bed! I'm not panicking or anything, I just wonder if I should be!? C
Posts.Title: taxotere side effects: infection question

Posts.Content: I think they use the cold cap differently in France as I only had it on for about an hour (for the duration of the treatment).  Maybe that's why it didn't work?  I had long hair for the first one, I didn't cut it at all. I think they just need to make it wet to allow more contact for the cold with the scalp. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Good luck with your op! C
Posts.Title: op date.

Posts.Content: I've just had second FEC (on Thursday).  Was slightly worse than first (nausea and sweating) but mouth problems a bit less.  Anyway, I bought a pineapple today! C
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: My mouth's not too bad yet (it's day 7 so maybe I missed it this time?)  Anyway will have pineapple this evening.  My mother in law was here all month (left this morning) and has left me a jug of freshly juiced beets and carrots and a bottle of wine that she had blessed by a priest (not sure that makes it healthier!) C
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: Glad to hear your good news! Hope the op goes smoothly, Caroline
Posts.Title: Some good news at last!!!

Posts.Content: I finished chemo on 28 Nov, mastectomy is booked for 2 Jan and am seeing radiologist on 20 Jan with a view to starting the radiotherapy in early Feb.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy Advice

Posts.Content: I feel the same.  Trying to psych myself up to pack hospital bag to go in for mx today (operation tomorrow).  Husband is coming back to look after kids but missed New Year with them (and lied about it to younger son "I might be back in time") so am pissed off. We came back from holiday yesterday so also need to unpack and put of washing (hope it's not all wet an smelly in the machine when I come out of hospital) am feeling crap and grumpy
Posts.Title: Bah humbug

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, I thought it was the chemo that caused the hot flushes.  I had my last period in August after 2nd FEC during which I had night sweats and some hot flushes.  That stopped and I had my last chemo on 28 Nov. the hot flushes started again in mid February.  It's mostly at night and not as bad as the ones I had on the FEC but last night I woke up soaked and had to change my nightie.  I am 43.  I'm hpinghtis isn't a permanent problem as I find it really bothersome. Possibly yours are due to anxiety?
Posts.Title: Hot flushers

Posts.Content: I had my last chemo on 28 November (taxotere after 4 FEC which started in July).  I had my last period in August. I had some terrible hot flushes and sweats with the first 2 FEC (waking up in a puddle) but that subsided and I had nothing of the sort with the taxotere. Now however, I find I keep waking up in the night feeling hot (not really sweating as such).  Do you think this a chemo induced menopause?  what else should I expect?  Or might I get my periods back after all (I'm 43) C
Posts.Title: Hot flushes?

Posts.Content: I was sleeping better but post radiotherapy my skin has cracked a bit under the arm and that's painful.  Children are on holiday for a week so I can lie around in bed without my bra on and let it air a bit. Glad you're home and feeling OK Marg!
Posts.Title: Getting better but can't sleep at night

Posts.Content: Thanks both.  It seems there's always something to worry about!  My physiotherapist suggested acupuncture to help with sleep I might give it a go. onwards and upwards! Cxxx
Posts.Title: Hot flushes?

Posts.Content: What are the options other than taking (useful) muscle from abdomen or back?  Is i better to just not reconstruct'?  I really don't want to mess up other parts of my body that are working fine for the time being!
Posts.Title: Following Mastectomy and Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Bio oil also good but maybe when it's healed a bit more. Good luck!
Posts.Title: dry peeling sore skin

Posts.Content: mine look as if they have dirt under them too.  Horrid, isn't it?
Posts.Title: Brittle nails

Posts.Content: mine look as if they have dirt under them too.  Horrid, isn't it?
Posts.Title: Brittle nails

Posts.Content: my sister was recently made redundant and has decided to work on her art too.  This is her website: http://www.babymassageposter.com/shop/page/2?sessid=177u7lrwyDaDtDjEuJhRZOM16XOadk50kfVx8JWBdgbA3qwQ6qFbMEp3dwUe3AR6&shop_param= (although I thought it was called London Plains hm)
Posts.Title: job v self employed as shattered n stressed all the time!

Posts.Content: Don't google anything! Hope your results come back normal. Cxxx
Posts.Title: Really scared!

Posts.Content: Thinking of you, Emma Hugs, C
Posts.Title: A Smorgasbord of Drugs

Posts.Content: I think we've all moaned on here - I know I have!
Posts.Title: I must say sorry

Posts.Content: Fantastic!  I laughed and so did my son
Posts.Title: Saw this and it made me smile

Posts.Content: I slathered my feet in vaseline and put plastic bags over them, then socks overnight.  That helped.
Posts.Title: sore hands and feet

Posts.Content: I used the cold cap and still lost most of my hair on FEC (it started to grow back on tax). The nurses said it was worth it even if your hair still falls out as it can stimulate re-growth. C
Posts.Title: cold cap??

Posts.Content: Hi Lizane, That sounds horrendous. I haven't had too many aches and pains but I have been taking the tramadol in advance.  The worst thing for me this time (number 2) was the sore throat and dry mouth.  The day before yesterday my tongue felt like learhter and was a weird colour and all cracked.  Bit better today, have been using an ild based mouth spray and gargling wit TCP.  I went to the gym yesterday - I pay my membership fee every month and haven't bee since July so I thought I should - I am so weak!  I nearly fainted!  Am now focusing on getting my body fit again before the operation. Good luck with the rest of the taxotere Caroline
Posts.Title: Taxotere Aches and Pains Update..

Posts.Content: I sunbathed during FEC but used high factor sunscreen and sunblock on my face.  (doctor told me off afterwards).  No lasting damage, but the skin on the soles of my feet blistered horribly.  I kept out of the sun when I started the taxotere. I used nail varnish with silicium from the first FEC and haven't lost any nails but after I stopped chemo I noticed they were brown (as if I were a heavy smoker - both hands and feet!) and I still have problems with my right hand and feet (nails are flaking off from the inside - looks like dirt but can't clean it out).  My fingers are still tingly on my right hand too (finished chemo end of November) but the brown bits are almost grown out C
Posts.Title: SUNSHINE!

Posts.Content: Thanks! I think things are going to work out all right.  Not how I would have wanted them to, but I didn't want to have cancer either.  I think I am getting more accepting in my old age (!)  Maybe it will turn out to be infectious!
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey, I'm feeling a bit like that today too.  The nurse came to look at my dressing and it was supposed to be the last time.  I have a plastic thing over the scar so I can have a shower (mx was on 2 Jan) but I can't leave it on until my husband gets back on Saturday and I don't want to ask my mother in law to help.  (so nurse is coming tomorrow again and I cried a bit - am now crying a lot) my husband (of 13 years) left me before my diagnosis (he said he assumed that because I didn't immediately quit my job and move with him to a different country it meant I wanted to get divorced!) and got another woman (an acquaintance of ours) pregnant (!!) but has now decided to leave her and come back to our family(!!!) but she is still living in his flat (!!!!) until the baby can get a passport (!!!!!).  It is entitled to a British passport through me (!!!!!!!!!) because that's how my husband got his British nationality. Husband is obviously feeling v guilty but is completely defensive and unsympathetic.  If I cry he says "You got what you wanted, I've come back, you've had the operation, you don't have cancer any more what are you upset about" (apparently it makes him feel stressed if other people, especially women, are upset.) I want him to acknowledge that yes, he is in an embarrassing and crappy position but lots of it is due to his choice.  I didn't choose to have cancer and I don't "choose" to feel upset. Please don't try to cheer me up by telling me my husband is a shit, he probably is but my sons and I love him and he loves us too in his own weird way (I think he probably has some kind of Asperger's) Anyway, didn't want to rant about myself, was going to offer sympathy. Life is tough, isn't it? C xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, Good luck with your treatment.  It sounds like you won't be having chemotherapy - great news!  I found that to be the worst part.  I'm over half way through the radiotherapy now and finding it OK.  As others have said it's the travelling that gets you down.  I go by metro so I am reading a lot!  I feel a bit tired but am not working so I can rest during the day. Keep us updated, Caroline
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: Thanks Helen, I just feel sometimes that they *do* actually know things and all this "everyone is different" is a bit of a whitewash to avoid telling unpleasant facts.  I'd like to know the statistics rather than "we don't know" or "it affects different people differently" or "we can't predict".  It's science for goodness' sake! argh!!!! C
Posts.Title: Pathologic complete response/ Residual Disease

Posts.Content: So, post mx, they removed the tumour and there was no lymph node involvement, but response to the neo-adjuvant chemo was "not as good as expected" and further chemo was mentioned. oncologist says he's leaning towards no further chemo, but I feel as if I am in limbo:  do I still have cancer or not? How can they tell? What are the recurrence rates? I feel like nobody is telling me anything. (sorry to moan) C
Posts.Title: Pathologic complete response/ Residual Disease

Posts.Content: I just can't face going back to work yet.  Partly because some aspects of my job were so stressful I wonder if they played a part in my getting sick.  and I am definitely enjoying spending more time with my children - the other bad effect of my job was on my family, which nearly broke down. Then again, they are paying me (excellent French social system) so that's an important factor in my decision. If I wasn't getting sick pay, I guess I would have had to bite the bullet.
Posts.Title: Brave people

Posts.Content: Hello, I've had 3 Tax now.  After the first one I got some weird spots on my back, horrible dry mouth and some muscle pain (took tramadol).  Second one, no spots but mouth worse.  3rd one mouth still pretty vile but my hair started growing back and my blood count came back to normal quicker than with FEC.  No appetite (have lost about 10 kilos) and some tiredness but mostly bearable after week 1. My final Tax is 28 November.  then I can enjoy Chhirstmas before mastectomy on 2 Jan. the end is in sight! C xx
Posts.Title: 2nd Taxotere tomorow

Posts.Content: I heartily endorse moaning as therapy!
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Janet, I found that the hot flushes (in terms of the sweats) were really bad during the FEC and then calmed down.  The bad news is, 5 months after finishing chemo they came back in force.  My Dr says there's nothing that can be done about them but that with time they should subside. My mouth tasted terrible with the FEC and I found pineapple (fresh or tinned) removed the layer of gunk that seemed to be coating the inside of my mouth.  Drink lots of water, rest, try to eat normally (not so easy!) Good luck, I've added you as a friend, Caroline
Posts.Title: FEC session recovery rate

Posts.Content: A bigger size is probably a good idea.  I lost a lot of weight on the chemo so my "normal" size is big now.  I was shocked when the prosthesis lady told me I needed an A rather than a B size. I also got some good sports bras from Primark (only 4 pounds!).  the bras at the specialist shop here in France are about 65 euro! PS Asda also have mastectomy swimwear at reasonable prices.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bra - daft question

Posts.Content: I got mine from Asda.  I bought my usual size and put the little cushion that they gave me in hospital in the pocket.  I'm still waiting for my prosthesis. Cxx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bra - daft question

Posts.Content: Hello, I've just downloaded it too.  I'll read it during my chemo tomorrow! Caroline
Posts.Title: Summer Reading

Posts.Content: I wouldn't have found you without google either!  Still, interesting link and will watch the film later. Cxx
Posts.Title: Why You Shouldn't Google - 10 Cancer Myths Debunked

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear you've had such a bad time!  Personally, I found the Tax easier than the FEC.  It wasn't pleasant but definitely not worse.  One of the good things was that my hair started growing back. I also lost weight during chemotherapy but am slowly putting it back on now. Good luck Caroline
Posts.Title: Moving from FEC to Docetaxel

Posts.Content: It's not as bad as it sounds, really!
Posts.Title: Does drainage happen to every one ?

Posts.Content: I think I only waited 2 hours after the radioactive injection … hope you get your scan done quickly and get results. hugs, C
Posts.Title: Bone Scan.

Posts.Content: Great news!  Have a relaxing weekend, Cxxx
Posts.Title: Bone Scan.

Posts.Content: I think I only waited 2 hours after the radioactive injection … hope you get your scan done quickly and get results. hugs, C
Posts.Title: Bone Scan.

Posts.Content: Great news!  Have a relaxing weekend, Cxxx
Posts.Title: Bone Scan.

Posts.Content: I used to do Bikram (hot) yoga and was thinking of going back, it's excellent for sleep, but I've just had all the lines drawn on me for the radio and don't want to sweat them off! Will ask radiologist next week. C
Posts.Title: anyone trying yoga?

Posts.Content: Fortunately I've only had positive stories.  The "They told him he had weeks to live and he's still alive 27 years later" sort. and nobody has asked for my running clothes, although my colleague is coming over in a  bit to look through my bag of unnecessary bras. Cxx
Posts.Title: Another "dumb things people say" video

Posts.Content: That's pretty much how my husband felt about it. He compared it to having a cold (for which I believe there is also no "cure")  He's changed his tune a bit since it came back and the oncologist said there was nothing they could do to "cure" it. Obviously people are not very aware for what cancer actually is.  (and it doesn't help that doctors don't really know either, grrr)
Posts.Title: Another "dumb things people say" video

Posts.Content: http://blog.thebreastcancersite.com/ridiculous-things-people-say-to-people-with-metastatic-breast-cancer/?utm_source=social&utm_medium=bcsfan&utm_campaign=ridiculous-things-people-say-to-people-with-metastatic-breast-cancer&utm_term=20140625
Posts.Title: Another "dumb things people say" video

Posts.Content: I wanted to go to Italy or Spain but husband insisted we stay in France.  Dr said best to go after 2nd, 3rd or 4th  FEC and same with Taxotere (i.e. not when you don't know what the effects will be). I went away for a weekend after FEC 2 , then a week after FEC 3 (much more expensive t go on holiday in france at the last minute than to go abroad! I also spent 10 days in Germany after the last FEC. Started Taxotere on Thursday (i.e. it's about day 5) and apart from a bit f joint pain yesterday and some stomach discomfort today I feel OK.  Much more energy than with th FEC though then I suddenly lost it all around 6pm.  Am planning to go to Scotland for a week between Tax 2 and 3. I've also travelled to and from London between treatments for various reasons - I guess as long as there is a hospital nearby ...  C
Posts.Title: Holidays

Posts.Content: I've reached the Simon Cowell stage and very unflattering it is too!
Posts.Title: And now I've got sideburns!

Posts.Content: It does get better!  I found I only had 2 or 3 really awful days (mostly dry mouth and bad taste) per cycle.  I just told myself "it'll be better in a couple of days" Good luck with your chemo, tax is horrid.
Posts.Title: Docetaxel - please tell me it gets better??

Posts.Content: Dear Emma, So sorry to hear your news, that's really shit.  I hope they sort it out for you as quickly as possible. :( love and hugs form France, Caroline xxx
Posts.Title: It's Back! And this time it's...

Posts.Content: I'm in France but coming to London tomorrow.  Can I just ring up and ask questions???  That's kind of exciting!  I've been having to ask everything in French so far :/ C
Posts.Title: FEC and sun

Posts.Content: I thought it was the Taxotere that responded badly to sunlight.  I was at the seaside for the weekend and though I didn't sunbathe as such, we lay on the beach for about half an hour (I was in a sleeveless shirt an rolled up my trouser legs) I didn't get burnt, but I have a deep tan on one shoulder and backs of legs that look really odd (big contrast between "tan" and pale skin)  Should we avoid the sun during FEC too?  I thought getting a bit of vitamin D might be a good idea! Am going on holiday in a week's time.  I have factor 50 suncream - that should be enough, shouldn't it? C
Posts.Title: FEC and sun

Posts.Content: for Gills
Posts.Title: Wig Photo (attempt)

Posts.Content: My son would agree with you Gill (he took the photo) he said "it's OK but would be better if you put on some eyeliner. LOL Caroline xxx
Posts.Title: Wig Photo (attempt)

Posts.Content: might even be brave enough to post pic of real "hair"
Posts.Title: Wig Photo (attempt)

Posts.Content: Hello, I've just begun my third month off work (no surgery yet, just chemo).  Actually, as I am a teacher, August was supposed to be leave but I took it as sick so as to be able to use the leave as necessary. Work is good in that they give 3 months off at full pay and another 3 at half pay, but I'm not sure I can survive on half pay - am waiting to see what Social Security offers (I'm in France so generally they are pretty good) Unfortunately my boss (who is a bit of a bastard) has just sacked our supervisor and apparently everything is in turmoil.  ALl my colleagues are saying "don't even THINK about coming back" so  am at a bit of a loose end. On the plus side, I am doing a distance learning course so can focus on my studies, and needless to say my kids are really happy to have a stay at home mum to take them to school and pick them up.  (my husband recently started a job in Luxembourg and is being a bit flaky.  Just before I was diagnosed he told me he'd been having an affair and wanted to get divorced but now is being supportive - when he can - he comes nearly every weekend.  But he is still in touch with his "girlfriend" while talking about our moving to Luxembourg to live with him) Argh!  Stress! C
Posts.Title: Returning to work

Posts.Content: Ha!  I started the distance learning course last October (diagnosed in June) so I had no way of knowing what was going to happen. Ironically I started the studies so I could get away from my insane boss and move with husband and children to Lux.  I thought about deferring but as I can't go back to work at the moment I may as well get on with it! Oh well, life is weird. C
Posts.Title: Returning to work

Posts.Content: thanks Marg!  34.99 from Pak's hair (posted link earlier) my French synthetic one coast nearly 10 times as much (will post photo for comparison)
Posts.Title: Wig Photo (attempt)

Posts.Content: Mx = mastectomy WLE = wide local excision FEC = 5FU, Epirubicin, cyclophosphamide DIEP = deep inferior epigastric perforators (had to google that one myself!) Tax = Taxotere/docetaxel TRAM flap = Transverse rectus abdomens myocutaneous (!) Maybe we can copy and paste this list with other abbreviations aded?
Posts.Title: Abbreviations

Posts.Content: I didn't have any injections (or steroids) for the FEC.  Very interesting the differences between countries! C My American friend gave me a compression bra to wear (to stop swelling) but hops said unnecessary.  Now of course I have swelling!  If they drain me again I think I'll use the bra!
Posts.Title: Self injections for 7 days

Posts.Content: 2 or 3 years ago my older son (then about 9 or 10) persuaded my to buy his a soft toy shark from IKEA (quite big, google!).  I never realised how useful it would be post operation!
Posts.Title: Special Cushions

Posts.Content: Saw radiologist this am but didn't find out when radiotherapy will start (they have a backlog so probably late March rather than Feb)  They also couldn't do the pre-radiology scan because I have some fluid build-up which she says the surgeon will drain on Wednesday (yuk) Anyway good news, all the cancer was in the breast (which has now been chopped off) and there was no spread to the lymph nodes (or if there was the chemo killed it off).  She sayys they removed 8 nodes but didn't seem to think it was important that I knew. Going to cinema to celebrate this evening
Posts.Title: Radiology appt

Posts.Content: I froze my gym membership during chemo/radiotherapy but am now paying my membership fees again.  I've been doing a bit of running but was wondering what else I can do.  I used to love Body Pump but I guess the combination of weights and repetitive movements is a no-no. Is there any exercise I can safely do for upper body strength/arms?  Are there any fact sheets? Caroline
Posts.Title: exercising post mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hello, I had this too, it started in my side (I couldn't even breathe properly) then travelled up to my shoulder.  Weirdly it's the opposite side to the one I was operated on. My phsyio said it was digestion related.  She said my colon is in spasm and that has affected all the nerves on the right side of my body.  she massaged it a bit (now side is fine but shoulder still excruciating).  I re-read the instructions on the tramadol packet and it seems to suggest 2 tablets is OK.  That's what I've been doing for the last couple of days.  Still hurts but not as bad and I managed to sleep last night for nearly 12 hours. :( C
Posts.Title: Severe shoulder pain

Posts.Content: Hello, I had this too, it started in my side (I couldn't even breathe properly) then travelled up to my shoulder.  Weirdly it's the opposite side to the one I was operated on. My phsyio said it was digestion related.  She said my colon is in spasm and that has affected all the nerves on the right side of my body.  she massaged it a bit (now side is fine but shoulder still excruciating).  I re-read the instructions on the tramadol packet and it seems to suggest 2 tablets is OK.  That's what I've been doing for the last couple of days.  Still hurts but not as bad and I managed to sleep last night for nearly 12 hours. :( C
Posts.Title: Severe shoulder pain

Posts.Content: Mine stopped after 3rd FEC.  I finished Tax at the end of November.  I had hot flushes which calmed down but over the last month the night sweating has started up again.  I am 43 and not taking any hormones as my tumour was triple negative.
Posts.Title: Periods returning

Posts.Content: I just got this again today, this time in the arm on my operation side.  I was sitting on a sofa while me son did judo and fell asleep, possibly in an awkward position.  The pain was so bad I was almost in tears.  Have taken tramadol and am feeling a bit better. :(
Posts.Title: Severe shoulder pain

Posts.Content: I just got this again today, this time in the arm on my operation side.  I was sitting on a sofa while me son did judo and fell asleep, possibly in an awkward position.  The pain was so bad I was almost in tears.  Have taken tramadol and am feeling a bit better. :(
Posts.Title: Severe shoulder pain

Posts.Content: Dawn, do you think I would be able to take a shortish train journey a fortnight after a single mastectomy?  I want to book tickets but am feeling superstitious ...
Posts.Title: mastectomy on 20th December

Posts.Content: Not for Christmas - I am doing a Masters and it's the final weekend workshop - last time I'll see my group and if I miss the lectures I'll be even more behind and stressed than I am now.  Not working means my studies are even more important. No breast care nurse in France ( or maybe not yet).  Have mammogram and appt with anaesthetist next week, will ask for advice but booked tickets today and am oping for best. You can't inspire me to feel up to it and then advise me not to go!!!! (joke)
Posts.Title: mastectomy on 20th December

Posts.Content: I went with 7-14 but didn't actually take any special precautions. Just told children to wash hands more often than usual.
Posts.Title: Which days are the most vulnerable.

Posts.Content: Hi Jacky, No luggage other than a computer and I'd be staying with my mum so would get waited on.  I think I'll book the tickets and hope for the best ... C
Posts.Title: mastectomy on 20th December

Posts.Content: Thirding!  If anyone can overcome all this, it's you! much love Caroline xx
Posts.Title: Is cancer not enough?!

Posts.Content: it's possible we all feel like frauds - there is always someone subjectively "worse off".  Let's stick together and support each other, there's no judgement here. C xxx
Posts.Title: Feel like a fraud on this site

Posts.Content: I finished chemo end Nov too.  Mx in jan and finished radiotherapy 2 weeks ago.  The second week after treatment was horrid, itching, swelling burning sensation, peeling skin but it's getting better now.  I'm hoping to put off going back to work until after the summer. My sick pay will run out end of June but then I have a lot of leave to take. I was having a lot of hot flushes at night but they have stopped waking me up (still wake up damp though!) good luck, C
Posts.Title: Back to work next week

Posts.Content: I was told showering OK but no bath for 3 months! (maybe 3 weeks, that sounds a bit extreme) but I remember it was long
Posts.Title: post op mastectomy dressing

Posts.Content: Hello, I had really bad sweats after my second FEC but then they went away. My periods stopped after FEC number 3.  I finished Tax at the end of November and had no flushes/sweating until the beginning of February when I woke up many times in the night feeling hot (but no abnormal sweating).  Since I finished radiotherapy (mid April) I have started having sweats in the night again (have to get up and change clothes). I wanted to know what other people's experiences were.  Will this stop/calm down in time?  Is there anything I can do to stop it (I've cut down on coffee and alcohol).  I read somewhere about wild yam supplements but don't know if these are available in France or whether it's effective.  the sweating is really annoying (only at night, am fine during the day).  We went away for the weekend and I had to take extra nightclothes with me! I'm 43.  For those of you whose periods came back, how long did it take? Caroline
Posts.Title: Hot flushes/sweats

Posts.Content: My tumour was hormone negative so this is definitely chemo related.  (I'm not taking any other tablets).  Will try the iced water and look into acupuncture. Thanks for the replies, C
Posts.Title: Hot flushes/sweats

Posts.Content: Hi Rhonda, I'm triple negative, but I asked my doctor and she said I shouldn't take anything. :(  she did say it would probably get better over time. It's grim.
Posts.Title: Hot flushes/sweats

Posts.Content: My husband compared BC to having a cold (he was trying to be positive!) saying it was very treatable nowadays (I didn't tell him that as far as I'm aware there's no cure for the common cold!) and also that I should see myself as a car that has broken down and the medical staff as engineers.  OK, but what about sympathy and support? Also plenty of comments about how great my wig is compared to my real hair "You always wanted straight hair" etc. Also I find it hard when people don't recognise me (although I suppose that's not really their fault)
Posts.Title: Most outrageous, ridiculous etc

Posts.Content: I'll ask my doctor about menopause tablets. I thought I'd got away with it yesterday, woke up at 2 am warm and dry (though in pain from my shoulder) then woke again at 5.15 drenched.  Argh! C
Posts.Title: Hot flushes/sweats

Posts.Content: I was given so many boxes of paracetamol and trmadol/paracetamol during taxotere that I didn't need to refill my prescription after the masctecomy, so I guess it's ok!
Posts.Title: Doxetaxel and codiene

Posts.Content: it's weird, isn't it?  I often feel as if the actual cancer part of having cancer is the least problematic! Glad to hear you are feeling better, hugs from Paris Cxx
Posts.Title: I've had such a bad day

Posts.Content: Hugs to you from Paris too, Marg!
Posts.Title: treatment overload

Posts.Content: My husband left me (and started an affair but didn't tell me!) before my diagnosis.  He's now broken it off with the other woman (although she is still staying at his house (complicated and long story, he told her we were getting divorced - didn't tell me! - and she lost her job and flat.  she's also pregnant to make matters worse) but is now being supportive (in his own way) and trying to come to appointments with me.  I'm in Paris and he is living in Luxembourg - in theory we'll all move there at the end of the school year (and the other woman will move back to Russia - she has no European visa after January so that's good)  I have no idea how he feels about the cancer, his friend told me that his first concern was that he might also have cancer and not know!  He's being a bit of an arse too "You're not working, why can't you keep the house clean and tidy and make sure you keep track of all our finances" and " when are you going to find out about going back to work" etc. Fortunately my sons are fantastic most of the time and I have a lot of good friends to help me (both French and English) I'm just waiting for all this shit to be over so I can get my life back (in some shape or form) C
Posts.Title: Alone after treatment with no one

Posts.Content: Hi Katharine, Trying to accept your friend request but having difficulty.  Will try again in a few minutes.  Whereabouts in France are you? My temperature dropped but I just checked again and it was 38.5 so not great.  The pain in my side has lessened a bit (shoulders still hurt) but my liver area is still hard and tender. I guess I will survive until Monday but it's worrying! Caroline
Posts.Title: Freaking out slightly

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone - I'm taking my temperature regularly and if I start to go yellow, I'll go straight to A&E.  On the plus side, the nurse at the cancer hospital asked about various symptoms (pain urinating, blood in poo, diarrhoea, vomiting etc) none of which I have and didn't seem to think it was urgent (but that I should definitely see the dr on Monday) Will keep you updated. Nice to know people are reading - this site really is a godsend! (teary smile) C
Posts.Title: Freaking out slightly

Posts.Content: temperature still OK, scan an 9am
Posts.Title: Freaking out slightly

Posts.Content: I've had indigestion for a few weeks now and a couple of weeks ago I noticed my  right side had gone hard.  I went to the doctor, had blood test and I have elevated liver and C reactive protein levels.  I booked a scan for Mnday but then I went to another doctor last night as I'd had a temperature for 3 days.  He really freaked me out saying I should "go to the hospital now" I told him my husband was away so he said I should go this morning.  But all the scanning clinics are either shut or booked up.  Hospital also doesn't do anything at weekends.  So am having abdominal scan on Monday but worried by this doctor's implication that I have a "large" lump in my liver. Arghhhhhhh He said he was worried because the blood test was onWednesday so he had not idea whether the levels were going up or down or staying the same. I did mention all of this to my physio and doctor and they were less worried, as was the nurse at the hospital
Posts.Title: Freaking out slightly

Posts.Content: scan found 2 masses in the liver (quite large, 7cm and 6cm) which would explain why I'm feeling discomfort.  Appointment with oncologist on Wednesday morning. Husband got straight on the train when he heard the news and is with me now and will come to appointment. C
Posts.Title: Freaking out slightly

Posts.Content: I saw the radiologist today and he again told me to rest in bed.  Hmm, so who will take my son to swimming and write my essay? On a more positive note he wrote me a prescription for a new wig.  The old one is getting ratty and my new hair is not well-behaved enough to go back to work with!
Posts.Title: So tired

Posts.Content: I'm nearing the end of radiotherapy (5 left!) and starting to feel really tired.  5pm is when it hits me too!  I froze my gym membership in December but it reactivates this month and I think I will take Ethel's advice and start working out again.  I also find the "not thinking" time extremely useful! I slept ten hours last night and didn't want to get up this morning. hugs to everyone, Cxx
Posts.Title: So tired
